page.title: 02MELSONBY-Past/Pres/Fut.Dev't
page.content: Apart from external renovation & internal modernisation, much of the old part of{Melsonby}fronting {East & {West Roads, High Row & Church Row, remain little changed from 100 years ago. Some of this modernisation has been done with the help of Government grants to owners during the past 10 years. A small number of new natural stone dwellings are being built opposite the Church, some of which involve the conversion of old farm buildings. The largest number of new houses have or are being built to the South of the crossroads, along{Moor Road}and{St. {James' Close.} These are a mixture of detached & semi-detached houses and bungalows for private and Council occupiers as well as retired peoples' bungalows. Further expansion of the village seems likely in the future.
